website_summaries.verdict: As the first retail-ready HomeKit product, Lutron's kit is just the beginning of Siri-integrated smart home control, but it works so well that I can easily recommend it today for any iOS users interested in plug-in lighting and dimmer products.
pros: The $230 Lutron Caséta Wireless Lighting Starter Kit is an elegant smart home solution that works extremely well, whether you're using the mobile app, your Apple Watch or Siri
cons: You have to use the Handoff feature if you want Siri to work on your Apple Watch
It has limited value for non-iOS users

customer_reviews.title: Great wink replacement
customer_reviews.text: Ok, maybe it doesn't do everything a Wink does, but the only part of Wink I used was the Caseta control anyway. Easy to set up, and the app is great. Integrated with Alexa routines and Im good to go. So long Wink and your subscription, hello Caseta Hub!
customer_reviews.author: n8sb

customer_reviews.title: If your light switch isn’t wired with a neutral, Lutron Caseta is the best option.
customer_reviews.text: I have an Apple HomePod in my bedroom and wanted light switches that I could use with HomeKit. My light switches weren’t wired with a neutral. My options were: 1 rewire my light switches. 2 connect the ground wire to the neutral terminal, which just sounds like a bad idea. 3 get Lutron Caseta light switch. Option 3 seemed like a good choice; Sure, I had to buy this hub but that’s an expense I could live with. I could have looked into getting smart lightbulbs I suppose but they are kind of expensive for a consumable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A

customer_reviews.title: Alexa, turn on the ceiling fan
customer_reviews.text: Love AI and now adore asking Alexa to turn on/off my ceiling fans and lights. I have scheduled the porch lights to turn on and off at dusk/dawn. So convenient and fun. I am not an electrician; just a handy DIYer. This Lutron Smart Bridge is required to set up Lutron's Caseta light controls and dimmers., which fit the light switch boxes installed in my home that was built in 1999. It took a little doing to connect the Smart Bridge and cell phone app, but the light controls easily connected once the two were ready to go. Fortunately Lutron has online instructions and videos that helped.
customer_reviews.author: Katya von Katnip

customer_reviews.title: It's low powered so it wont cost too much in ...
customer_reviews.text: It's low powered so it wont cost too much in electricity per year. Anything that is wifi would use up more power. This thing will have to connect to Lutron servers, so one day the servers went down, and it did not work. I thought something was wrong on my end, so I spent hours to play with it, reset it, everything I could think of, until Lutron sent an email that the servers were down. I wish they had sent the email earlier. I would of save me from all that pain. But for the most part it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Q. To

customer_reviews.title: These are super easy to install and work flawlessly with the Lutron ...
customer_reviews.text: These are super easy to install and work flawlessly with the Lutron App. I also synched them with my Echo and Alexa turns on/off my lights as well as dims them just with a simple ask. I replaced 2 (3-way) set ups in my living room and kitchen as well as the pendant lights on my kitchen island. By installing the remotes as switches in the wall they look and act just like a 3 way switch. The hub connected easily and has never lost connectivity (1 month so far). I replaced Lutron switches that I had already so I am a fan of their products and this one simply works great and easy to install and setup.
customer_reviews.author: Nevets

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: After struggling to get my Lutron switches installed I was very pleased with the simplicity of the Smart Bridge installation! Works flawlessly and I have mine integrated with Amazon Alexa. The app is great and has many nice settings and scenes. Now if Lutron could make their switches as easy it would be a wonderful world! P.S. I am not saying their switches are bad, just not as easy to install as they lead you to believe due to wiring and device incompatibility that they do not disclose.
customer_reviews.author: uneasybuyer

customer_reviews.title: Safer house with peace of mind when I'm not there.
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to this equipment, I'm now able to run my lights when I'm out of town/state. My Smart Home tech put it together in what felt like seconds. and the app is real easy for me to use. Thanks Lutron. It arrived when it said it would, in good shape and ready for install.
customer_reviews.author: Tes Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit. Secure. Excellent HomeKit Integration!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the product and its HomeKit support. Installation of the switches was easy. The design of the switches and remotes take a bit to get used to. Bought the wall adaptor for the remotes so the simulate 3way switches. Fired up the AppleTV and now I can tell Siri to turn the lights on,off and dim to a certain % from anywhere there is Internet access. Wanted to stay away from Insteon, Wink, and Samsung because they use the "cloud" for control leaving you vulnerable to security breaches.
customer_reviews.author: ClayR

customer_reviews.title: I have a lot of smart stuff in my house thats all connected to alexa
customer_reviews.text: I've had this kit for about a year. I have a lot of smart stuff in my house thats all connected to alexa. theses switches seem to just work, all the time. It seems like the hue setup has more fun stuff you can do with it. But i knew what i was buying and im very happy w the ease of installation and reliability of this system. If you can change a wall switch you can install this kit, if you cant, tgeir tech support is great and will walk you through it.
customer_reviews.author: nathanTop Contributor: Hydroponics

customer_reviews.title: Try this I think you will really enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: I love this kit. I just purchased my second one. One suggestion I have is to be sure and download the right phone application since Lutron has more than one phone application and if you download the wrong one like I did it might be difficult to identify why it is not working. Also, if you have difficulties like I encountered then don't wait to call their support line, like I did, because the support staff were very helpful and got my devices up and running quickly.
customer_reviews.author: William I.

customer_reviews.title: Quirky
customer_reviews.text: Tiny box seems like it would have been better off as a wall brick on an outlet. Fairly straight forward install, but there were some issues with HomeKit integration. The Z-Wave protocol is slightly counterintuitive for dealing with install issues. I believe the maximum device to device range is 30 ft line of sight, so pay attention to distances.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a first generation Wink product but its stability, speed and level of vendor support had been going down hill for several years. I decided to make the switch to the SmartThings controller which does not have the in-built interface to Caseta products. So I bought the Caseta hub and, though it seems a bit pricey for its limited utility, it was very easy to set up and easy to integrate with the SmartThings hub. Now my devices, including my Caseta devices, are much more responsive and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little device.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I have it set up in IFTTT so I can trigger events and that works nicely. The App is very good and also controls my Nest thermostat. I love the 'scene' feature in the app so I can set a room a certain way. I use this with my Lutron wireless shades and wireless dimmer to control my home theater room. It works quite well. It's sitting in the middle of my house and so far communicates fine through the walls. I'll update this review as I add more devices if I run into any snags.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan V

customer_reviews.title: Nearly a perfect starter kit
customer_reviews.text: I really like this kit as it has most of everything needed to start hooking up your lighting to your connected home. The Smart Bridge is easy to set up, and wiring is as simple as it gets. Pairing all the components was easy, so I was up and running in only a few minutes. I probably spent more time messing around with the packaging than anything else. My only complaint is that the remotes come only with pedestals, and no wall-mounting plates that allow them to be put alongside other switches. These plates aren't expensive, but they are hard to find in stores, so just be prepared to mount using removable adhesive strips (which work very well).
customer_reviews.author: jtsholtod

customer_reviews.title: The perfect smart home solution for Apple.
customer_reviews.text: I use Siri and this Hub integrates wonderfully. I have at least 30 lutron casseta wall switches with pick remotes and a dozen Serena shades in my house. The system is rather responsive compared to many other smart devices I’ve tried. Also the range is pretty surprising, I have it centralized in my house and it gets to every corner of my 3700 square foot two level home.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopaholic

customer_reviews.title: If you need it get it, if you're starting out with home automation pass on Lutron.
customer_reviews.text: Lutron is expensive. I was an early adopter and I paid ( and paid and paid) for it. I went through two wink hubs and then had to buy this because I went with Lutron switches. It's a good product. Buy it if you need it, but if you're looking to start home automation there are better and less expensive options.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Baum

customer_reviews.title: Works! Ethernet cable = Yuck!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Added alexa to my dimmers Cons: It needs an ethernet cable to get access to your internet network where your light dimmers and everything else is on wifi. Was a breeze with the eero pro though. Still why ethernet?? There’s a light on it that’s always on.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: This has surprisingly good range. I have this inside a cabinet approximately ...
customer_reviews.text: This has surprisingly good range. I have this inside a cabinet approximately 30' from a switch that is in my attic and it works with no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works with Apple Home Kit
customer_reviews.text: I really like this system and can't wait to purchase more units. The switches don't work with the Hyperikon LED lights. They have a loud hum (buzzing noise) to the lights. It's important to try and get the bulbs that are listed to work with the switches. This appears to be a common problem. The switches really rock and work with Apple home kit. I can turn on/off my lights with my Apple watch, phone and iPad. It even is easily programed to come on when you get close to your home.
customer_reviews.author: PkScott

customer_reviews.title: Home automation for your lights with voice control, yep, plays nice with Alexa!!
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly in my house... makes my light switches play nice with Alexa... now when I'm busy cooking with raw meat covered hands, I can turn on, adjust the brightness or turn off my lights purely by talking to Alexa and avoiding 3rd party home automation systems that cost an arm and a leg and require maintenance from a 3rd person.... been there, done that and never again!!! Love love love this!
customer_reviews.author: Ella Arey

customer_reviews.title: They work! I've made my dumb home into smart home with these by hooking them up to my Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: First off they work as advertised. The switches are easy to install and control. I love the fact they can be controlled using my Alexa. I would highly recommend these over the Hue lights if color is not important to you. Led light bulbs are really cheap and can be bought in bulk unlike the hues. With the hues you also have to either replace your light switches with a hue wireless switch or tape over your existing one to prevent people from accidentally flipping it off. With the Caseta you don't have to worry about that. The Caseta also works with with a 3 way lighting setup!
customer_reviews.author: Neil Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Lutron Nails It!
customer_reviews.text: I love this system. It works (almost) flawlessly. It's really easy to install. It's super convenient and works with Alexa excellently. The native app works well but I don't use it much. The switches work good too. I only have one issue with one switch and I'm just not sure I'm adjusting it properly. Sometimes it will flash a little but it's pretty rare. Again, I love this. It's great. Also, it's the best in the market when you are working with no neutral wires.
customer_reviews.author: FreedomMech

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Great switches.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the Lutron line. If you need a "no neutral required" this is the way to go. If you want a dimmer that looks like a normal paddle switch (decora style) there is another brand "Insteon" (requires the Insteon hub) that you may like better. These dimmer switches have on/off buttons and up/down as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan H.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Alexa seamlessly, be sure to unpair legacy devices
customer_reviews.text: I had some Caseta devices that had been previously paired via WINK. I had to take the added step of unpairing/resetting those before they would integrate with this device, but once done everything works perfectly and integrates with Alexa. For the past week, my full experience since installation, it has been faster and more reliable than WINK.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon1

customer_reviews.title: Nice Surprise-WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Connects easily and quickly. Lights respond instantly. You need to make sure switches are at factory setting before trying to connect. Pairs to switches and pico remotes in the same procedure. Only have used a short time. Hope smooth functioning continues.
customer_reviews.author: old L

customer_reviews.title: It Just Worked
customer_reviews.text: This worked so surprising well with my Caseta Wireless Smart Lighting Switches. I cabled it to ethernet, powered it on, installed the android smartphone app, and it autodiscovered/autoconfiged and Just Worked. It feels so light and unsubstantial, but I was pleasantly surprised. The response between the phone app and switch actuation is measurable in tenths of seconds. Super cool. I was expecting a headache but I was up and running in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Traugott

customer_reviews.title: LUTRON Bridge Setup very easy!
customer_reviews.text: Used with LUTRON Smart Switches. This item was very easy to setup as long as you have an extra spot to plug the Ethernet cable. If you have no plug you need to set up a splitter/adapter to plug into. All I had to do was set bridge on shelf and plug in supplied 120 volt plug/transformer and then the supplied Ethernet cable from WiFi to bridge. All done and everything is working great.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: internet of things is here
customer_reviews.text: The bridge is not wireless however I had plenty of space next to my wireless router which also had an open port so it was a hassle free setup. Download the lutron app which does everything for you. Installation of the in-wall dimmer is just like any other switch installation, same form factor, wiring, etc. The stands are beautiful as well however I would have appreciated instructions on how to detach the remote. The app is very intuitive, siri integration works great, setting up scenes for quick collective actions is very practical.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Lags with Harmony
customer_reviews.text: This did not play nicely with my Harmony Hub. For whatever reason, the lights take anywhere from 2-5 seconds to turn on after truning them on my Harmony Elite and within the Harmony App. I know Lutron isn't responsible for Harmony's integration of Caseta but when its an open system like this it makes everyone look responsible.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable lighting solution.
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Casetta in three homes. It's a very reliable and stable system that works well. My only gripe is that, in the app, you cannot switch between different properties. You need to establish a different account with a separate email address for each. Which is absurd. I got around this problem by using the Apple Homekit app, which does a better job with this.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how well it works
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how well this tiny little thing maintains such perfect connection all over my 3400 foot 2 story home even in the garage. Their fan controller are the only HomeKit items that have never said no response. Can you please make thermostats, door locks, garage door openers too.
customer_reviews.author: TechNerd

customer_reviews.title: Most reliable smart hub I have used
customer_reviews.text: Had Wink 1 and 2, but mostly for Lutron lights so moved to this. I can say adding devices and integrating Alexa is super reliable and quick / easy. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Scantron

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: This works fantastic for your two wire situation. Connects to Alexa relatively easy. Love the fact that when the family is out later than expected we can just turn on the lights from our phone. Never come home to a dark house
customer_reviews.author: Keith A. Hoppe

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of bridges till now
customer_reviews.text: Worked flawlessly! Easy setup and great customer service. I was trying to hold off on using any bridges for my smart home. I had to use this for a light fixture and I'm glad I did. The bridge is small, clean and can be easily hidden.
customer_reviews.author: EMC

customer_reviews.title: Dimming ramps suck and can cause LEDs to blink if they are turned up abruptly.
customer_reviews.text: Set it and forget it. While I wish it would ramp the dimming more gently like the buttons on the dimmer does, it’s decent. I never think about it, which is good. I’ve never had to reset it. It works even when the Internet goes down.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bock

customer_reviews.title: super easy setup
customer_reviews.text: I bought a home that has lutron caseta switches. But the former owners left manuals. I bought the bridge, downloaded the app, and all switches are now working and controllable by the app or Google home mini. Super easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Creditman

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Used this to connect all my switches to our Google Home. Setup was super easy and all our switches work great with Google Home. I should have ordered the kit rather than buying this separately, but that's my fault.
customer_reviews.author: John Cokkinias

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this device. We actually have seen a cost savings in electricity because we now can tell when lights are left on and we turn them off - even if we are not home. It works with Apple Homekit as well as Amazon Echo. If you are even halfway handy, you can easily install this yourself. If you have a three-way light switch, you will need to utilize the remote. Make sure you follow their directions and mark the wires as indicated. If it's a standard light switch, it's a piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: TBone

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and use. The app can be used away from your home where the apple home app requires a stay at home iPad or pod. Great for randomizing lights when away and setting schedules ( for instance porch lights on at sunset off at sunrise)
customer_reviews.author: Jean Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great technology for home automation, easy to install and program!!
customer_reviews.text: Really pretty cool technology!! These are easily installed and managed through the mobile app. The pico remotes can be paired with a single switch, or multiple Caseta switches/dimmers. I replaced the old timer switch which was difficult to program. This one you can do with the app, plus it's Apple HomeKit compatible, also has some neat features like geofencing, and scene programming. I've bought more of these to include the non-dimmer switch, which I used to control a three way garage light. I've installed others in places where it makes sense to have remote control of lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t let the fact that you have to shell out 80 dollars or so for this bridge for the Lutron switches and accessories as it is well worth it. This worked smoothly and seamlessly the first time. I have tried other wireless switches and they are not in the league with this system. I will be purchasing more switches soon.
customer_reviews.author: somewhereoutthere

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Setup was somewhat clunky and took way too long to complete for a simple installation. The app lacks some expected features, like a vacation mode and is rudimentarily designed. That said, it does work and having the ability to turn on an off my outdoor lights remotely or on a schedule is very nice for added security and piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and worked great. Have had for several months with over 70 devises in my house. I had to order a second bridge because one bridge can only handle 60 devices. This works great with HomeKit since each bridge needs it own account, HomeKit can control all devises on both bridges seamlessly. Only complaint is that I needed 2 bridges.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic system
customer_reviews.text: Just install the switches I happen to be an electrician installation was simple I was very nervous about programming switches with my hub. The app was absolutely simple, installation was ez had everything up and running within minutes. I just installed LED lightbulbs works with them great would highly recommend this system.I have an iPhone I used Siri to turn the lights on and off worked great
customer_reviews.author: riteprice

customer_reviews.title: Lutron Smart Bridge
customer_reviews.text: Device was difficult to setup, had to wait for the new firmware to upload. Once it did, everything went smoothly. You are look and 30-45 minutes depending on download speeds before it works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Caljackson

customer_reviews.title: Wow this is great
customer_reviews.text: This freed up my WiFi and is very responsive. Unlike WINK that slowed down WiFi and now has a $4.99 monthly fee. I ordered this for all my Lutron switches and outlets and got it 4 days early. Very easy to install and use. Release everything from your wink hub first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install for a DIYer with some electrical experience
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install for a DIYer with some electrical experience. If you can wire an outlet or light switch, you can do this. The system responds quickly to commands from remotes and software -- much faster than some other stand-alone (hub less) devices I've tried. The "favorite" setting is nice but the wall switches do not support that feature themselves: it's only accessible using software or the remotes.
customer_reviews.author: B. Talbot

customer_reviews.title: This is a great kit but make sure you don't need the SmartBridge ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kit but make sure you don't need the SmartBridge Pro. The Pro allows you to integrate with some alarm systems but it usually only sold via wholesalers. Lutron has 24 hour tech support via telephone. It's great and they were able to help me figure out a wiring issue late on a Sunday night. I was very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: David in Denver

customer_reviews.title: Bye Wink!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t believe how tiny it was. All hubs should be like this! Works great would all my Lutron switches, dimmers and plugins.
customer_reviews.author: HC

customer_reviews.title: Misrepresentation - not a "Smart Kit"
customer_reviews.text: This is represented as a Smart "Kit", which includes two Caseta smart switches and a Smart Bridge (which would have been a very good deal for $110). However what was sent to me was just the Smart Bridge by itself, which normally sells for about $80, not $110. The product description needs to be updated to reflect what the product actually is. I returned it immediately and will probably buy one locally since it's very rarely discounted.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: nice, but expensive
customer_reviews.text: It works just fine, but the price is very high just for a remote lightswitch. If you use the app to turn lights on or off from your phone, the app cannot let you do it instantly. It takes about two seconds.
customer_reviews.author: jalbracht

customer_reviews.title: Reliable control
customer_reviews.text: Reliably controls the Lutron Caseta switches in my home. However, I see no way in which to have the lights fade on and off as they do when they are activated directly at the switch. That was a bit disappointing. Integrates well with Alexa and with the Harmony Hub
customer_reviews.author: Ron K

customer_reviews.title: Great for home automation!
customer_reviews.text: It is a consistently great performer. I use it in my master suite. I ask Alexa to turn off the lights at night (Rather than reaching ALL the way over to my nightstand to touch the PICO remote (How LAZY have we become???) The scheduling is easy and intuitive, and there is a sunrise/sunset timer which is GREAT. I want the master suite to turn on before sunset, and not have it turn on at 4pm every day, which is a waste of energy in summer. It has never gone offline, and Alexa has never said "Sorry, I can't find the lights". This is a great device.
customer_reviews.author: AJL

customer_reviews.title: Best in the biz for Apple - hands down
customer_reviews.text: Lutron has the best electrical smart products on the market...hands down. Everything works outright and the app is awesome. Wished Lutron made smart fan controllers too!
customer_reviews.author: warren8rwarren8r

customer_reviews.title: The best part is that it is easy to set up ...
customer_reviews.text: The best part is that it is easy to set up the app and program the dimmers. The dispointing part is that these dimmers are not well suited for led's since they don't go completely out if you are using the dimmer for one light. They only way they go to dark is to load up the dimmer to the max of 150 watts which sort of makes them useless if you are trying to conserve power by using led's. I am sure they will work great for incandesant.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Oneil

customer_reviews.title: Great for older homes.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, nice for older homes due to the ‘third’ wire issue. Allows me to control my recessed LED lights through multiple devices ie, HomeKit, Alexa etc. Took off 1 star because it has lost connectivity twice.
customer_reviews.author: Lexie

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great way to control lights and put them on timers / scenes. Easy to use and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Gator9er

customer_reviews.title: Very responsive and good range
customer_reviews.text: Lutron Caseta is much more responsive and has much better range than my Z-Wave switches and ZigBee (Philips Hue) products. Same distance comparison.
customer_reviews.author: SleepyMilotic

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, good app
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, good app, good phone support. I had to buy it to make my Caseta wireless switches work with Google Home. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Engineering persona

customer_reviews.title: Caseta is great, hub works well.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Caseta system. It’s easy to set up and the add-on wall-mountable Pico switches let me add extra switches wherever I want.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: product is ok
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this product with some of the dimmer via apple home kit and it not very good, better off using the lutron app
customer_reviews.author: Erick Wheelock

customer_reviews.title: Great switches
customer_reviews.text: These are the greatest switches, easy to setup, easy to integrate with Alexa and home automation
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dodge

customer_reviews.title: Capable of taking a good chewing
customer_reviews.text: My dog got a hold of it and chewed it up, but it still works. Bonus for us, he chewed the back off so now we have access to the battery!
customer_reviews.author: notlohdahc

customer_reviews.title: amazing product, well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I was hoping for and more. Integrates well with Apple products and the siri function is amazing. I also use it to turn on lights using the GPS function on my phone. When I return home, the system turns on key lights so I don't walk into a dark house. Love this smart home system.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M Dahl Jr.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: After 2 weeks of use: works as expected - easy to set up and manage. The companion iPhone app is not impressive. I hope this hub learns to play nicely with non-Lutron products in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: SJS

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff!! Hooked up to wifi easily, works great! Says it works with IOS "Home" automation, which it does, but it doesn't do what you set up in the Lutron app. However, Siri does the unique themes you build in Lutron
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Wireless Smart Lighting Startup Kit
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic starter kit. Installed the bridge and connected 2 Bed lamp dimmers Lutron P-PKG1P-WH-R White. Will be connecting the wall dimmers soon a long with the rest of the house lights and fans. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Coastie

customer_reviews.title: I really like the Caseta Wireless family of products
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly. I have 8 switches and 1 outlet plug and love them. I have tried products by 2 other well known manufacturers and have had problems. These are great.
customer_reviews.author: Rentman

customer_reviews.title: Turn on lights from anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Love my wireless switches. Paired it to Alexa and can turn lights on and off from anywhere in the house or when I'm away. Very easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Order seperate and save
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and then realized the kit is MORE expensive than purchasing two separate kits. Order the P-BDG-PKG1W kit $80.00  & the P-PKG1W-WH dimmer+remote for $59.00  comes out to $140.00 and you get all the products in this kit for less.
customer_reviews.author: KallMeKG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I've used Lutron dimmers for decades and decided to try these fancy ones out. Could not be happier with the results.

product_meta.title: Lutron Caseta Wireless Smart Light Dimmer Switch (2 Count) Starter Kit with Pedestals for Pico Wireless Remotes, Works with Alexa, Apple HomeKit, and the Google Assistant | P-BDG-PKG2W, White
product_meta.description: Style:Deluxe Dimmer Kit with AccessoriesControlling lights, shades, and temperature from a mobile device has never been easier or more reliable. The Lutron Smart Bridge allows for setup, control, and monitoring of Casita Wireless dimmers and Serena Remote Controlled Shades from a smartphone, tablet, and even your Apple Watch TM wearable. The Lutron Smart Bridge also works with select Honeywell Thermostats, Logitech Harmony remotes, Apple Home Kit and Affinity Comcast. Schedule lights to adjust automatically based on the time of day, or create your favorite scenes that adjust multiple lights and shades with the press of a button. Enable Geofencing to automatically turn your lights on/off when you leave or approach home, or to notify you that you left your lights on. All compatible products sold separately. Starter kit includes (1) Casita Wireless Smart Bridge, (2) Casita Wireless In-Wall dimmers, (2) Pico Remote Controls, (2) single tabletop pedestals, and (2) one-gang Claro wall plates. Pico remote controls take (1) CR2032 battery, included in remotes.
feature_bullets: PEACE OF MIND: Set lights to automatically adjust with changing seasons so your family always comes back to a well-lit home; you can also enable the Smart Away feature to randomly turn your lights on and off to look like you’re home even if you’re away
MOST CONNECTED: Caseta connects with more leading smart home devices – including Alexa, Apple HomeKit, the Google Assistant, Serena shades and Sonos – than any other smart lighting control brand

CONTROL YOUR WAY: Caseta puts the smarts in the switch so you can control your lights a variety of ways – via the free Lutron app, your voice, or from the wall. Schedule lights to change at set times, or activate lighting scenes with the touch of a button
RELIABLY SMART: The smart bridge doesn’t use Wi-Fi, so you get super-fast, ultra-reliable smart lighting that works right, without slowing your Wi-Fi down with more devices
SET IT AND FORGET IT: Always keep your smart light functionality. Even when the Wi-Fi goes down, there’s no need to reset your schedules and scenes or reconnect everything when it comes back online

GET MORE, SPEND LESS: One Caseta smart switch can control many bulbs at once; make many bulbs smart, even your existing bulbs. Get smart control of multiple styles of dimmable LED, incandescent, and halogen bulbs
WORKS WITH EXISTING WIRING: Unlike other smart dimmer switches, Caseta works in any home, of any age, as it does not require a neutral wire

EASY 3-WAY SETUP: Create a 3-way by mounting the Pico to almost any wall surface without cutting holes or pulling wire, with a Pico bracket (PICO-WBX-ADAPT sold separately). Replace existing 3-way switches by mounting the bracket and Pico over the backbox
